properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 6 at 12:41AM HST until February 6 at 3:30AM HST by NWS Honolulu HI
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Honolulu has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
The island of Kauai in Kauai County

* Until 330 AM HST.

* At 1235 AM HST, the stream gauge at the Hanalei River Bridge is
reporting water levels above the flash flood threshold. Flash
flooding is expected in the vicinity of the Hanalei River Bridge
for the next several hours.

HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain.

SOURCE...Stream Gauge indicated.

IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads,
properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road
closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible
in steep terrain.

* Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Hanalei and Princeville.
properties.instruction:
A Flash Flood Warning means that flooding is imminent or occurring
within the warned area.

Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even
if they are currently dry.

Do not cross fast flowing water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn
around, don't drown.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 3:30 AM HST. Avoid flooded areas.
